text:
Preparing Turnips Pick your turnips. Rinse them with running water. Then, soak them for a few minutes to dislodge dirt and rinse again. Choose small to medium turnips. Set aside turnips that are already losing their firmness for immediate use. Peel your turnips. Discard the peels or use them in compost. Clean peels are a good addition to vegetable stock. Cut the turnips into one-half inch (1.6cm) cubes. Blanching Turnips Heat water in a large stockpot on the stove. Bring it to a rolling boil. Make an ice bath in a clean sink or in a large bowl. Place it near the stove. Pour cut turnip cubes into your boiling water. Allow them to blanch for two minutes. Remove the pieces with a large slotted spoon. Place them directly in an ice bath. Keep them in the ice bath for two to five minutes. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fa\/Freeze-Turnips-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Freeze-Turnips-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/f\/fa\/Freeze-Turnips-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/aid4325175-v4-728px-Freeze-Turnips-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

Freezing Turnips Grab handfuls of the drained turnips. Blot them with a paper towel or a kitchen towel. Pack them into sealable plastic bags or other freezer-safe containers. Leave one-half inch (1.6cm) headspace. Press on the bag to remove as much air as possible. Seal tightly. Store the turnips in your freezer for up to 10 months. They can be stored in the refrigerator for up to three weeks.
sentences: Preparing Turnips Pick your turnips.
Rinse them with running water.
Then, soak them for a few minutes to dislodge dirt and rinse again.
Choose small to medium turnips.
Set aside turnips that are already losing their firmness for immediate use.
Peel your turnips.
Discard the peels or use them in compost.
Clean peels are a good addition to vegetable stock.
Cut the turnips into one-half inch (1.6cm) cubes.
Blanching Turnips Heat water in a large stockpot on the stove.
Bring it to a rolling boil.
Make an ice bath in a clean sink or in a large bowl.
Place it near the stove.
Pour cut turnip cubes into your boiling water.
Allow them to blanch for two minutes.
Remove the pieces with a large slotted spoon.
Place them directly in an ice bath.
Keep them in the ice bath for two to five minutes.
